intro: Excoecaria rhomboidea, commonly known as the African rum, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 5 meters in height, characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in panicles, followed by red, fleshy berries. It is often found in coastal areas and sandy soils, thriving in humid, warm climates. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and recognizable species within the Euphorbiaceae family.
